-C.value: try { Use-Icinga; } catch { Write-Output 'The Icinga PowerShell Framework is either not installed on the system or not configured properly. Please check https://icinga.com/docs/windows for further details'; exit 3; }; Exit-IcingaPluginNotInstalled 'Invoke-IcingaCheckDiskHealth'; exit Invoke-IcingaCheckDiskHealth

11.description:
Critical threshold for current Disk Queue Length is the number of requests outstanding on the disk at the time the performance data is collected.
It also includes requests in service at the time of the collection. This is a instantaneous snapshot, not an average over the
time interval. Multi-spindle disk devices can have multiple requests that are active at one time, but other concurrent requests
are awaiting service. This counter might reflect a transitory high or low queue length, but if there is a sustained load on the
disk drive, it is likely that this will be consistently high. Requests experience delays proportional to the length of this queue
minus the number of spindles on the disks. For good performance, this difference should average less than two.
11.caption: DiskQueueLenCritical

3.description: Specify the index id of disks you want to exclude from checks. Example 0, 1
3.caption: ExcludeDisk

20.description: Warning threshold for avg. Disk sec/Read is the average time, in seconds, of a read of data from the disk. If the threshold values are not in seconds, please enter a unit such as (ms, s, m, h, ...)
20.caption: DiskAvgReadSecWarning

12.description: Warning threshold for Avg. Disk Queue Length is the average number of both read and write requests that were queued for the selected disk during the sample interval.
12.caption: DiskQueueAvgLenWarning

10.description:
Warning threshold for current Disk Queue Length is the number of requests outstanding on the disk at the time the performance data is collected.
It also includes requests in service at the time of the collection. This is a instantaneous snapshot, not an average over the
time interval. Multi-spindle disk devices can have multiple requests that are active at one time, but other concurrent requests
are awaiting service. This counter might reflect a transitory high or low queue length, but if there is a sustained load on the
disk drive, it is likely that this will be consistently high. Requests experience delays proportional to the length of this queue
minus the number of spindles on the disks. For good performance, this difference should average less than two.
10.caption: DiskQueueLenWarning

17.description: Critical threshold for disk Write Bytes/sec is rate at which bytes are transferred to the disk during write operations.
17.caption: DiskWriteByteSecCritical

13.description: Critical threshold for Avg. Disk Queue Length is the average number of both read and write requests that were queued for the selected disk during the sample interval.
13.caption: DiskQueueAvgLenCritical

18.description: Warning threshold for avg. Disk sec/Transfer is the time, in seconds, of the average disk transfer. If the threshold values are not in seconds, please enter a unit such as (ms, s, m, h, ...)
18.caption: DiskAvgTransSecWarning

23.description: Critical threshold for Avg. Disk sec/Write is the average time, in seconds, of a write of data to the disk. If the threshold values are not in seconds, please enter a unit such as (ms, s, m, h, ...)
23.caption: DiskAvgWriteSecCritical

19.description: Critical threshold for avg. Disk sec/Transfer is the time, in seconds, of the average disk transfer. If the threshold values are not in seconds, please enter a unit such as (ms, s, m, h, ...)
19.caption: DiskAvgTransSecCritical

5.description: Specify the partition drive letters for disks to exclude from checks. Example C:, D:
5.caption: ExcludePartition

4.description: Specify the partition drive letters for disks to include for checks. Example C:, D:
4.caption: IncludePartition

8.description: Warning theeshold for disk Writes/sec is the rate of write operations on the disk.
8.caption: DiskWriteSecWarning

26.description: Set this to include only disks that have drive letters like C:, D:, ..., assigned to them. Can be combined with include/exclude filters
26.caption: CheckLogicalOnly

14.description: Warning threshold for disk Read Bytes/sec is the rate at which bytes are transferred from the disk during read operations.
14.caption: DiskReadByteSecWarning

22.description: Warning threshold for Avg. Disk sec/Write is the average time, in seconds, of a write of data to the disk. If the threshold values are not in seconds, please enter a unit such as (ms, s, m, h, ...)
22.caption: DiskAvgWriteSecWarning

25.description: Ignores any disk which is having the state `Read Only` and returns `Ok` instead of `Warning` for this specific state
25.caption: IgnoreReadOnlyDisks

9.description: Critical threshold for disk Writes/sec is the rate of write operations on the disk.
9.caption: DiskWriteSecCritical

15.description: Critical threshold for disk Read Bytes/sec is the rate at which bytes are transferred from the disk during read operations.
15.caption: DiskReadByteSecCritical

21.description: Critical threshold for avg. Disk sec/Read is the average time, in seconds, of a read of data from the disk. If the threshold values are not in seconds, please enter a unit such as (ms, s, m, h, ...)
21.caption: DiskAvgReadSecCritical

24.description: Ignores any disk which is having the state `Offline` and returns `Ok` instead of `Warning` for this specific state
24.caption: IgnoreOfflineDisks

16.description: Warning threshold for disk Write Bytes/sec is rate at which bytes are transferred to the disk during write operations.
16.caption: DiskWriteByteSecWarning

7.description: Critical treshold for disk Reads/sec is the rate of read operations on the disk.
7.caption: DiskReadSecCritical

2.description: Specify the index id of disks you want to include for checks. Example 0, 1
2.caption: IncludeDisk

6.description: Warning threshold for disk Reads/sec is the rate of read operations on the disk.
6.caption: DiskReadSecWarning
